body_content.explanation: to leave your job or stop working because of old age or ill health:
examples: Since retiring from the company, she has done voluntary work for a charity.
He is due to retire as chief executive next year.

body_content.explanation: to stop taking part in a race or competition because of illness or injury:
examples: She retired from the competition after pulling a leg muscle.

body_content.explanation: to make someone leave their job, usually at a time when they are near to the age at which they would normally stop working, or because of illness:
examples: Following the merger, he was retired with a generous pension.

body_content.explanation: to leave a room or group of people and go somewhere quiet or private:
examples: After dinner our host said, "Shall we retire to the drawing room?"
It had been a long day, so I retired early.
